audio_item.dc.title: Sound Recording - (Anthology of Interviews) [Christiaan Barnard on Heart Transplants; Fleming on BAM and demands for higher education] ([R159B]) - 1968 January 03
audio_item.dc.contributor.author: WUOM (Radio station: Ann Arbor, Mich.)
audio_item.dc.rights.access: This material is available for research only in the Reading Room of the Bentley Historical Library at the University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI).

A single tape may yield multiple audio files if there were variations in tape stock, speed, or channels (i.e. stereo or mono). For more information see http://deepblue.lib.umich.edu/handle/2027.42/108126.
audio_item.dc.abstract: [Program 47] : [Side 1] : [Part 1] : [Segment 1] : Anthology of interviews, dubbed June 12, 1971. Press conference with Christiaan Barnard March 6, 1968; First Heart Transplant, University of Michigan Hospital, September 23, 1968.

[Program 47] : [Side 1] : [Part 2] : [Segment 2] : December 3, 1968; Press conference with Robben W. Fleming; On Draft and Student Grades, tutition for in-state and out-of-state students; athletics. January 3, 1968; Robben W. Fleming Meeting with BAM; CBS Interview with Robben W. Fleming April 15, 1968, Student unrest: S. I. Hayakawa, President of San Francisco State College; Robben Fleming of U of M; Morris Abram President of Brandeis University]; Press conference with Robben W. Fleming in Traverse City [MI], July 24, 1969; last 6 minutes discusses student radicalism.
